                                              Section A

Answer one question from this section. Each question is worth [15 marks].

Hinduism

1.   Discuss how female deities in religious scripture and festivals may offer role models for Hindu
     women.


2.   Discuss how the concept of samsara (cycle of life, death and rebirth) is central to Hindu beliefs.



Buddhism

3.   To what extent are the Four Noble Truths the most important statement of Buddhist belief?


4.   To what extent is veneration of the Buddha the most important part of Buddhist ritual?



Sikhism

5.   Compare and contrast the importance of the different Sikh sacred texts.


6.   To what extent is Sikhism a religion based on equality?



Open-ended question

7.   With reference to one religion, either Hinduism or Buddhism or Sikhism, discuss how the principal
     sacred texts were composed and how they are used today.

                                                  Section B

Answer one question from this section. Each question is worth [15 marks].

Judaism

8.      “The Torah is the only source of authority for Jews.” Discuss.


9.      Examine Jewish teachings about the nature of God.



Christianity

10.     Discuss the ways in which the Old Testament and New Testament Canons were compiled.


11.     Discuss the importance of the sacraments in different denominations.



Islam

12.     Discuss how rituals are an expression of the umma (worldwide community of Muslims).


13.     “The Qur’an is only the Qur’an if it is written in Arabic.” Discuss.



Open-ended question

14.     With reference to one religion, either Judaism or Christianity or Islam, discuss beliefs about
        eschatology.
